name: UIToolbar
desc: A control that displays one or more buttons along the bottom edge of your interface.

items.name: protocol UIToolbarDelegate
items.desc: The UIToolbarDelegate protocol defines the interface that toolbar delegate objects implement to manage the toolbar behavior. This protocol declares no methods of its own but conforms to the UIBarPositioningDelegate protocol to support the positioning of a toolbar when it is moved to a window.

items.name: var items: [UIBarButtonItem]?
items.desc: The items displayed on the toolbar.

items.name: func setItems([UIBarButtonItem]?, animated: Bool)
items.desc: Sets the items on the toolbar by animating the changes.

items.name: var standardAppearance: UIToolbarAppearance
items.desc: The appearance settings to use for a standard-height toolbar.

items.name: var compactAppearance: UIToolbarAppearance?
items.desc: The appearance settings to use for a compact-height toolbar.

items.name: var scrollEdgeAppearance: UIToolbarAppearance?
items.desc: The appearance settings for a standard-height toolbar when the edge of scrollable content aligns with the edge of the toolbar.

items.name: var compactScrollEdgeAppearance: UIToolbarAppearance?
items.desc: The appearance settings for a compact-height toolbar when the edge of any scrollable content aligns with the edge of a compact-height toolbar.

items.name: var isTranslucent: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the toolbar is translucent (true) or not (false).
